text.text: Try to go so you see the gardens in the late afternoon or early evening so you can see the change. They are bigger than you think so give yourself a few hours. The inside attractions are interesting and keep you cool. Walking outside can become very hot. Great experience

text.text: Iconic and must see place in Singapore. There's plenty of different kind of graders, some have only flora, others include props like animal sculptures made out of wood or mini houses by the brook. Everything was colorful and vibrant, definitely recommended to check it out, but if you wanna see everything, prepare to spend there a few hours. I wish I had the time to come back to see those artificial trees in all their glory at night. Maybe next time.

text.text: You definitely need to visit when you're in Singapore. Make sure to set aside enough time to explore everything. The Cloud Forest and Flower Dome are absolute highlights. If you want to see it all, plan to spend about half your day there. Try to grab lunch during quieter times to dodge the crowds. Take your time to admire the plants and soak it all in. It's such a fantastic spot to visit. Highly recommended!

It's such a fantastic spot to visit. Highly recommended!

text.text:
Gardens by the Bay in Singapore is absolutely breathtaking!
The gardens' serene atmosphere, stunning architecture, and lush greenery created a tranquil oasis.

Highlights
1.Supertree Grove: Iconic tree-like structures lit up at night.
2. Flower Dome: where you discover diverse plant species from around the world.
3. Cloud Forest: Misty, tropical forest with stunning waterfall.
4.Interactive exhibits: Insight into sustainability and conservation.
5.Evening light shows: Spectacular displays.

The Facilities has dining options: Variety of restaurants and cafes.
Gift shops for unique souvenirs.

Garden by the Bay is an amazing experience with stunning landscapes, innovative architecture, and educational experiences.  A must-visit destination in Singapore.

text.text: Really nice park to walk around for tourists and locals alike. Cool to see all the different types of trees. Sadly I didn’t have time for the domes but I heard they’re well worth it. It’s truly a beautiful place.
